website_summaries.verdict: One of the only mobile bar handles you can take with you. It uses two powerful suction cups to attach to common hard surfaces around the bathroom.
pros: Strong suction cup surfaces keep the handlebar well-secured to a variety of bathroom surfaces
Great mobile solution on the go
cons: Small length makes the bar less useful in common bathroom settings

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe!
customer_reviews.text: I have a fiberglass shower. I made 10+ attempts to install this and it would fall off within 3 or fewer minutes even after being properly installed with the green lights indicating so. I called a friend who is a contractor and he read the instruction and attempted installation and the same thing happened again and again. We tried several different areas of the tub, it did not matter where it was placed. Fully smooth surface, cleaned, dried. Failed and not trustworthy even if it did hold at this point given I have seen how it can be indicating safe the moment to later fall off. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is just perfect for my new bathroom
customer_reviews.text: This is just perfect for my new bathroom. We just updated my mother-in-law's bathroom. Putting in a walk-in shower with glass doors took away a much needed hand rail. Amazon came through with this grab bar and our problem was solved. The suction is super strong and the green lighting up feature is reassurance that it is properly installed and ready to be used. I needed something that would be strong, functional and did not have to be permanently mounted to the tile. My tiles were 14" so it was easy to avoid the grout lines and make a secure contact as has been recommended.Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: john fruzynski

customer_reviews.title: No slide perfect grip shower bar
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my mom had knee replacement surgery and we have a steep tub. It was well worth it. I was skeptical because in the past I have purchased similar products that cost more money and did not work. The tub we have is plastic and it took 2 mins. to install. Very strong that it holds in place with full body weight of over 230lbs. Its great to have if you just don't want to slip in the shower. Update: My mom uses her full body weight on it and it has not slipped. As long as you put it on a plastic tub (not tile) you can trust it will be well worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni O

customer_reviews.title: Large suction cups quickly adhere to tile and I positioned it hip height so I would be able to walk around tub easily. Was so ha
customer_reviews.text: I am a 6 ft.1in, 240 lb. man recovering from a total knee replacement. Bought the first bar as my tub requires me to step in and I wanted the security of support. Large suction cups quickly adhere to tile and I positioned it hip height so I would be able to walk around tub easily. Was so happy I purchased a 2nd one! Great support at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo

customer_reviews.title: Comes off unexpectedly.
customer_reviews.text: Over the long term I have found this product to be unreliable. You just never know when you reach out to grab it that it will suddenly come completely off the surface you had it attached to, which in my case was the shower wall. Have tried rubbing alcohol to completely clean and prepare the surface and it still performs poorly. I have found that in order to somewhat rely on it you must remove it once per week, clean the area and the bottom side of the cups themselves then reattach. ALWAYS TEST FIRST BEFORE YOU ATTEMPT TO USE.
customer_reviews.author: CopOut

customer_reviews.title: I recommend wiping down both the suction cups & tiles with ...
customer_reviews.text: Based on my experience, described below, I recommend wiping down both the suction cups & tiles with tap water before mounting the handle: The first time I used it, I cleaned the tiles with an alcohol wipe - It stayed up for around 4 month. The second time I cleaned both the wall & suction cups with alcohol wipes: - It stayed up 3 days. The third time I cleaned both the wall & suction cups again with alcohol wipes - It stayed up 2 days. The fourth time I cleaned both the plain tap water - It's stayed up over 8 months & is still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Not at all secure
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and questions, and felt confident that this product would stick to my granite shower. I bought two, installed one about half an hour ago. I made sure the surface was clean and dry, and that the green secure lock indicators where in displayed. I tugged on it, and it felt secure. It has already fallen off the wall twice, and I was not even in the room either time. These will be going back.
customer_reviews.author: A G Miller

customer_reviews.title: Too bad it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It would not stay on the wall. I have large smooth tiles in my shower, I adhered the bar in the center of the tiles per directions. The tiles were clean and dry. The green indicator showed it attached properly. The problem was it stayed on during the shower, then an hour or two later, it fell off the wall. I tried 3 times, and if fell off every time. After finding it on the shower floor for the 3rd time, I'm returning it. Too bad it doesn't work. It is attractive and the hand grip was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jupiterose

customer_reviews.title: Secure and reliable safety device
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other suction handles before and not been pleased---they all tended to slip and sometimes without warning. Not true with this one! This baby is easy to set and rock-solid, with indicator windows that let you know whether it lost a seal. After my wife had her hip replacement, I double checked the handles daily to make sure they were firm. I didn't want to risk her falling in the shower. Pull...push....wet...dry...nothing I could do would make them come loose! It gave my wife confidence and me peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Deacon Mike

customer_reviews.title: VERY DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: This does not work. It will not stay in place. It’s very dangerous. I know I’m installing it correctly. I know it’s not the tile because I installed a different brand and it works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Stay Stuck Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I was staying in a rental while my condo was being renovated. The shower there didn't have a grab bar and the getting in and out of the shower was treacherous! I needed SOMETHING and have used these suction-cup grab bars on vacation. I knew when I bought it that it had a suction problem, but it seems to work the best of these types of tools. It sticks OK when you put it up, but some hours or days into its use, you'll suddenly hear a loud noise (bang!). When you go to investigate, you find it's just grab bar, fallen off the wall AGAIN!
customer_reviews.author: Elise in Palm Springs

customer_reviews.title: Leaves  rust stains!
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely happy with this when I first got it stayed attached to the wall, and did the job I purchased it for. A few months later I removed it the clean and fiund huge rust marks on my tile! Knowing this was going in the shower why didn't they use plastic or stainless steel in these hidden areas, which would not rust?
customer_reviews.author: newstudent

customer_reviews.title: Ordered another one
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these about a year ago and we have had good luck with it in our shower. We have fiberglass shower stalls and they work great on them. I have only had this product come off one time. There are cheaper ones on the market but I stayed with this one. Once you put these on they are hard to get off. They have a small tab to tug on and it releases. As we get older it is important to have something to hold on. I did not want to drill holes in my fiberglass enclosure so this works great.
customer_reviews.author: Good Luck BP

customer_reviews.title: Grab bars have an indicator that shows if the suction cups are secure but fell off in 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Be Careful! I liked the indicator showing that the grab bars are secure on the surface I applied them to, turning from red to green however they did not stay on for more than a day. They were a good size for the bathtub area so I put them in for my brother who suffered 2 strokes and hoped they would help him feel more secure while taking a shower. Unfortunately on the first day they both came loose and fell off which, if my brother had been using them could have caused him to fall and seriously hurt himself.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Did not stay on wall.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2. Installed in rental property for elderly tenant. Seemed to be very nice, until I received a call from my tenant. The bar fell off the wall. She found it laying in the bath tub. I do not feel comfortable trying to use it any longer. I purchased 2, but have not tried the other. Unfortunately I believe I am past the return date to request a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Signora Cosima

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This did not work at all. We tried and tried to install this in my mom's bathtub, but it just fell off, or came off in my mom's hand. I hate to say useless, but that's exactly what it is. Even worse it's a hazard. I cant understand how this got any decent reviews, because it was not stable or strong at all. We finally just gave up trying, and instead called our local Senior Citizen volunteer contractors who came in and had to drill metal grab bars into the tile. I feel like my parents are at least safe now.
customer_reviews.author: Liv D.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. I installed the product correctly and it appeared to be in place; however, a few minutes later when I got into the shower and grabbed the bar, it came down I almost fell!! I tried again a few days later and again the bar came lose and crashed to the floor of the shower. Be aware. This is a death bar.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnstyr

customer_reviews.title: Won't Stay Attached
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a week now and we had to bungee cord it to the wall so it wouldn't fall off and be lost (outside wall over water). It falls off regularly. This is smooth fibreglass and we get two green signs that a seal had been made. Finally just took it off. Waste of time and money for me. Too bad as I just wanted a hand hold, not even to put weight on it. Never got to use it even once. It either came off in my hand or was already hanging from the cord I attached.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not What I  Needed
customer_reviews.text: I must give credit where credit is due, I was warned that the grab bar would not support weight meaning that one cannot use it to pull themselves up or to hold on to to sit down. Since this is the main reason for getting the bar to begin with, I don't understand why they would recommend this for the elderly or handicapped. It will periodically lose its suction, so one needs to make sure it is engaged before using or re engage it before use. If one just needs to touch something to make them feel stable or sturdy, then this will work, but I would not recommend this item for anyone who needs to use it for support.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny Byrd

customer_reviews.title: These grab bars are hands down excellent!
customer_reviews.text: These are terrific. My wife had knee replacement surgery and I needed to put grab bars in our shower. I have 4" tiles and was able to install these very easy. The suction indicators assures that there is always a tight suction. I can tell you that the will not come off the tiles until you want them to come off. We had a home inspection done by the physical therapist and they were very impressed with these grab bars. I am very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: Bert S.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for shower
customer_reviews.text: Simple to put on wall and reasonably good grip. But I wouldn't place my full weight on it when using as an assist. It's perfect for use as a help getting in and out of tub/shower, and/or for steadying yourself once in. Applies to shower wall very easily, and has a "lock" position for best suction. Also has a unique feature which shows the strength of the suction with a green/red dot once locked in. We've bought a few of these from Amazon as they have a good selection of sizes, good price and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: EASY & SECURE - jperfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these after husband had an accident and needed assistance with getting in/out of shower. Super EASY to install (less than 30 seconds) and quite secure. I placed one on a slight angle to help getting in and out of tub. Placed the second one on the back wall for additional support. Initially placed it horizontally, but one end showed RED two different times. When I repositioned it a good deal of water leaked out so I placed that at a slight angle as well. Since then both indicators on both grab bars show green. Thanks for making a great, easy to install product!
customer_reviews.author: JC's mom

customer_reviews.title: An excellent shower handle and grab bar, and great value
customer_reviews.text: “Having had major surgery, I needed something to help support me in the shower. I bought two of these grab bars and was surprised by the strong suction on my plastic shower wall. They are very good quality and a lot of my weight was put or pulled on these grab bars and they did not come off the wall. I am very pleased with them. They also have a little flap at the side to make pulling the grab bar off easier whenever one wants to take it off. The design is also nice and blends in well. I've been using shower grab bars for 22 years and this is the best one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Serious Taurus

customer_reviews.title: Works "okay"
customer_reviews.text: These do have a good suction and are great when first installed and tested. However, after the shower and hours (or day) later they do have the tendency to fall off. Which is no big deal....a simple re-suction install. The green buttons show that it is a firm grasp and the red is DANGER. However, green or not, I would test the sturdiness of each handle before using, even if the button shows green. Very nice device to help in getting in and out of shower (stepping over the door railing.
customer_reviews.author: Hesitant to use name

customer_reviews.title: Believe all the 1 Star Reviews-I should have
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews but felt that if I followed all the instructions including any tips provided by other purchasers, the item might work for me. I was so wrong! I was very careful installing on my fiberglass shower, used once, but was very careful using it and checked it the next morning and it was totally disconnected on one end. Do NOT waste your time or money on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Richards

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - USE WITH CARE.  It indicated "SAFE" with green but fell off with minor pressure.
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for about 9 months. Great suction and held on strong. But twice in last month, while indicating "safe" with "green" showing -- it fell off with minor force. It appears, when I inspected the unit, that the indicator (metal spring with color code) can corrode or bind and "freeze" as set, e.g., "safe". BUT while the indicator is frozen as "safe" ... the suction unit behind is definitely unsafe. No one hurt by this at my house BUT beware. I will get a different unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chemical Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Promising but not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a support for when my 91 year old father visits. First opportunity to use them since purchase revealed they seemed very sturdy and had great suction. Unfortunately, that's not the case. The first one popped off the tile surface in about 8 hours and clattered to the floor. Retried after double checking that the surface was clean and that the suction cups were not overlapping any grout lines. Green indicators confirmed. 4 hours later, the suction cups failed again. This happened on both grab bars - placed on different tile surfaces in the shower. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dbea

customer_reviews.title: Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: Like all the rest on the market. They hold for a while and tend to lose suction sometimes only in a matter of days. All instructions followed on a perfectly smooth, flat, non porus surface, thoroughly cleaned and dry; it still lets go at indeterminate times, so I really can't trust this for use by an elderly person who could be seriously injured when the suction leaks and the grip releases. I would only trust the ones permanently installed.
customer_reviews.author: Wildthing33

customer_reviews.title: Great design but won't stick to shower wall
customer_reviews.text: I like the design but I can't get it to stick on the shower wall. I'll have to call customer support for help. The wall is clean and dry which they indicate in the instructions but it won't stay attached to the shower wall for more than a couple of hours. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy DeV

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to put in the shower for my husband who returned home after an extensive hospital stay. I cleaned the smooth, tile 4x4 tiles on the walls twice with alcohol. One bar fell off after about an hour; the other stayed on but the one suction cup disconnected and the color turned red. I washed the walls again. One fell off after an hour the other stayed on but the one suction cup disconnected and the color turned red. Obviously, these don't work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: MaryW

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two. Surface is new faux marble and exceptionally smooth and non porous. Units will hold maybe 48 hours without having to be re attached for firm hold. Didn’t want to drill so it’s my best alternative so far. We only use to steady our balance. Upon Knowing the above and you don’t mind re-setting the suction lever every other day or so they work “ok”. Do not depend on to break a fall or pull on with substantial weight. Still deciding regarding return.
customer_reviews.author: CLYDE N.

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe it... but it works
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe it but it works. Insane as it seems, it will hold several hundred pounds. And stays on for months. There are two "lengths" of this bar. I recommend the shorter one with the cups closer together, the longer one is too far apart to hold permanently and will not hold total body weight. I also recommend using them vertically, especially for the longer base one. Clean the area first, this only works on tile or similar.
customer_reviews.author: TheStig

customer_reviews.title: hard plastic with soft touch overmolding to make it comfortable. The body is smooth and shiny to match ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is first class. It is well designed, hard plastic with soft touch overmolding to make it comfortable. The body is smooth and shiny to match tile. Very high quality of plastic molding. Installation took less than 10 seconds. They have been up now for about 3 months and are sturdy. I originally bought 2 and have decided to buy one more. Very satisfied with this purchase. One caution. Be sure that where to place the suction cups is a solid smooth surface to allow the rubber cup to create a vacuum. If you have small little tiles with groves it probably won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Norman B

customer_reviews.title: shower wall gripper
customer_reviews.text: so far, I like the size of this grab bar, but the first time it came down off the shower wall while I was using it. I started over in another spot (shiny tiles), cleaned it thoroughly. It stayed on! If this continues, I will be very pleased with it because it has powerful "grippers". Will keep you posted. Edited: it actually did not stay on the wall and we ended up discarding it. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: margie

customer_reviews.title: this is the perfect and effective solution to prevent slippage for my elderly ...
customer_reviews.text: Short of a complete renovation to install a shower stall which would cost $10k, this is the perfect and effective solution to prevent slippage for my elderly father's bathroom. I'm giving it only 4 stars because it does fall off the walls every now and then so dad has to re-apply it. But other than that, it attaches pretty solidly on the wall and gives my dad a lot of comfort that he won't slip and fall. I got 2 of these, one for next to the shower door and another next to the shower itself. Great innovative product!
customer_reviews.author: Hungry Buya

customer_reviews.title: Works well in our fiberglass tub/shower
customer_reviews.text: By accident I just touched it against the fiberglass shower while I was getting ready to put it on the wall, and it started to stick. I had to use the plastic tab to release it. Then I put it onto the space where my elderly mother in law needed it and tested it.I didn't pull it as hard as I could have but gave it a good pull, much harder than she would use for entering and leaving the shower/tub. It would have been difficult to find a stud behind the fiberglass so this was what we needed. She likes the support that it gives her.
customer_reviews.author: David Rand

customer_reviews.title: came off
customer_reviews.text: I was in hospital for 4 months and needed something sturdy for be to able to shower, well I have has it several months and it was good, well yesterday while taking a shower, grabbed it and it came lose and I fail. ant how this is not as u advertised said it was sturdy and would last, well it didn't, very upset about this, wanted u to know before somebody buys and fall and get hurt bad. thanks
customer_reviews.author: wayne crabb

customer_reviews.title: The 'Vive Grab Bar' seller is not a store to buy from
customer_reviews.text: The inside rim of one of the suction cups has a yellow-brownish layer of something that is not removable. The spring-cup connections are different on both sides. The light indicator works on one end but not on the other. This is without a doubt a used item. I threw it in the trash; it's not worthwhile contacting a seller who finds it acceptable to sell such crap.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ita

customer_reviews.title: Falls off wall too easily
customer_reviews.text: This was for my 96 year old dad. His occupational therapist put it on the wall in the correct manner. It 'locks' onto the wall and stays up for a couple of hours then slams down into the tub. One side even 'broke' after a couple of uses. I was unable to lock it 'safely' after a few uses. Definitely NOT safe enough for anyone with balance problems to use. Threw it out. :(
customer_reviews.author: Beverly A. Qualheim

customer_reviews.title: good price,easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this is inexpensive so I was skeptical, but it's a great product. grips well, has indicator lights to make sure it's on right, good size handle. Everything as described on product info. Only draw back is that granite is not one of the intended uses because it is porous, which I didn't think about when I bought it, but I have another bathroom that I use it in. Thanks to the sellers for the text to let me know about granite not being one of the intended uses. Might have saved an accident. That is the only draw back I found with this.
customer_reviews.author: seattle shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Saved having to drill holes with the real possibility of creating cracks in our expensive custom tiles! Further, since our purpose for the handle was strictly for "balance" ... and not heavy weight bearing ... it was a perfect solution! The handle is very well made, sturdy and grips very tightly ... and I especially appreciate the holding reliability ... confirmed by the red/green indicator feature! Great price and quick delivery too! I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Beck

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful if you install them correctly!
customer_reviews.text: This bar is big and sturdy and very easy to install. However, if you install it incorrectly, there are two very tiny circles at the top and bottom that alert you that it is not secure . That is a great feature BUT the dots are so very small that it is difficult to see whether they are green (correctly installed ) or red( incorrectly installed) I suggest they make the indicator dots bigger ( yes I am a senior citizen!)
customer_reviews.author: Mamaglobird

customer_reviews.title: Out of 3 different erent brands, this one fails to hold for an hour
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 different brands. This one looked good because it has suction status colors indicating if it's holding. Clean, solid surface in the shower and an hour later.... Crash boom bang. Wiped it down, next day same thing. Mom doesn't need this. Sorry bit I had to return it. The changing lifestiles one still holding afyer 1 week. Please test your vrips before using and do it EVERY TIME.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbaloooo

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: It was very frustrating. I purchased 2 large and 1 small bar. I applied to clean, dry tile. As I went to install the second one I noticed the red indicator on one of the first bar that I had installed. I reset that one and went on to the third one when the first one fell off. I picked that one up to reinstall it when the first one fell off. I tried one more time with all of them at once but within a short time they all fell off the wall. Each time I am certain that they were centered on the tiles.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Calendrillo

customer_reviews.title: didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Was excited when received the hand rail - looked impressive. Unfortunately had to return because no matter how hard I pushed could not get the shower hand bar to connect to the side wall of the shower. Simply didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: UNABLE TO INSTALL
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I am unable to install the grab bar since my shower wall is constructed of 4 inch tiles separated by 1/8 inch grout making for a slightly uneven surface. It would be nice if the vendor could supply 2 thin plastic circles about 6 inches in diameter with a waterproof adhesive to bond them to the tile. On a perfectly flat horizontal surface the grab bar appears to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wald

customer_reviews.title: Lost suction
customer_reviews.text: I'm reserving judgement until I have had the product a while. For now 3 stars because after less than 24 hours the grip fell off the wall. It's a smooth wall and when first applied it was on really good. I have reapplied and will see how long it lasts suction to the shower wall. My past experience with shower suction items is they will eventually fall off and just need to be reset. I am hoping once I find the "sweet spot" this grab bar will be up for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Caem

customer_reviews.title: Suction handle not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install but never used it. Suction doesn’t hold for long. Keoted falling down . Purchased it for support in shower following my hip surgery . Never used it... afraid it would lose suction and I would fall .
customer_reviews.author: Zelda

customer_reviews.title: Good grab bar if use with precautions.
customer_reviews.text: The grab bar worked as advertised. It provides a solid grip for getting into and out of tub/shower. However, once in a while , one of the suction cup will detach from the wall.. so before putting any weight on the grab bar, the user should shake the bar to check that it is is still solidly attached. The user should also remember the bar is for maintaining balance, not for putting all your weight. On it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay
customer_reviews.text: This did not stay on my shower wall at all, and I wasn't even using it to really pull up my full weight, more for balance purposes. My shower is smooth, no tiling or textures and I followed the instructions (multiple times!). However it never stayed on for more than a couple days. I'm glad I don't have a disability or anything that would make me rely on this for support because it certainly isn't safe.
customer_reviews.author: TKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I had difficulty getting one suction cup to retain a seal. But, after scrupulously cleaning the wall and fhe suction cup, the seal has held so far [about a week]. However, as I'm using the hand hold in a shower, I check the seal every time I get into the shower. There is a visible indicator that tells you whether the seal is holding or not.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Test before using
customer_reviews.text: When this grab bar works, it's great. There are color indicators that are supposed to alert you when the suction is weak. Sometimes the suction is great when the indicator is red. You just have to test it every time before you count on it. But when it works (which is most of the time after not being used in several days), it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Cary L. Holman

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Product:  Extremely well-made, inexpensive and quite useful
customer_reviews.text: Tremendously well made product, with amazing holding power and very, very, supportive in the shower. There's no way you could every pull this thing off of the shower wall once you have the suction cups activated, yet easy to remove once "unlatched". Really easy to use, handy of safety (and for hanging a towel on!) and large enough to be practical but not in the way. Tried to buy a second one, and Amazon was sold out....that's how good it is! And, inexpensive as well. Not sure why the warranty is only for 60 days, because this thing looks like it will last years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I had some doubts about buying this after reading reviews of the grip slipping or not properly adhering to the shower surface. Well, for me the grab bar works great. Easy to install and remove, and sticks to my shower wall like white on rice. I yanked on it hard just to be sure. Great product at fair price. Thanks Vive!
customer_reviews.author: cone gobbler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for adding a sense of stability without permanently altering shower area.
customer_reviews.text: Husband has MS and difficulty raising leg/foot. The walk-in shower has a grab bar in the back but he often felt unsteady since there was nothing for him to hold on to when first stepping in to it. This is exactly what he needed!! The hardest part of installing it was actually getting it out of the package and ñdetermining where he wanted it. I have walked by several times and pulled on it just to see if it's secure....it has never budged. This grab bar has met my expectations - actually, in a couple different ways it has exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Granny P

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this product
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. In fact, it came recommended from a hospital in which I was being cared for in. Sadly, upon installation against clean dry marble, and not between any grout lines after 15 to 20min they would simply fall off. Perhaps, resources need to be redirected to R&D. I depend on grab bars after two spinal surgeries although, at this rate perhaps it would be safer finding alternate means to entering and exiting the bath/shower area.
customer_reviews.author: The Lucky One

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't like an uneven surface, stiff cups
customer_reviews.text: This suction cup is too stif to work on a molded bath/shower wall that is slightly textured. I've had other cups that form over the texture, this requires a polished flat surface. I'm keeping it, I've siliconed a couple of strategically placed clear plexiglass pieces to the shower wall. It'll work, looks okay.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Whoopee for this grab bar!!!
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar is fabulous. Because I'm elderly and have a few mobility problems, I do balance exercises, but I'm afraid of falling. I applied this grab bar to my granite kitchen counter to "grab" when I stand on inflated balance discs and it has worked out beautifully. When I need the counter space, I just flip the little levers and move the bar out of the way. It's a quality product, reasonably priced, and I'm happy that I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Dolly Domestic

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 45 year old daughter who just fractured her ankle. Upon receiving her delivery she that she was sending it back because 1) nothing sticks to her shower wall and 2) she felt that only elderly people need the assistance of a shower handle. Well she called the next day and said - Yeah ~ for the handle - it stuck to the shower and she couldn't believe how much holding on to the handle actually stabilizer her in the shower. So Kudos for your Terrific product!
customer_reviews.author: Game player

customer_reviews.title: Works best on tile only.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars because it is a good product however really not made for a fiberglass surface. It really should emphasize that it’s made for smooth flat tile surfaces only. So if you are needing to use it on tile it will work perfect for you. Fiberglass don’t trust it unless you thoroughly check it every time you get into the shower, which you will most likely have to reinstall it every time because it’s laying on the floor of your shower.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sals

customer_reviews.title: It would have have been the perfect solution to our needs for added security in our ...
customer_reviews.text: We were very impressed with the quality of the product. It would have have been the perfect solution to our needs for added security in our two showers. The16 inch model was substantial enough and the removable ability would have allowed us to find the best position through trial and error. Disappointingly however, we need to return them since the material on both our showers is too porous for the bar to adhere. I contacted the seller's customer service via email to determine whether I was attaching them improperly and they were very helpful in determining the cause of the problem.
customer_reviews.author: slodave

customer_reviews.title: Suction does not hold!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the grab bar I received was defective and one of the suctions failed repeatedly after a few minutes despite repositioning. Customer service was excellent and advised me to return the product to Amazon. I was unable to exchange for another so had to return then reorder. I do not have my replacement yet. Update: I received my replacement today and it is no better than the first. After 10 minutes it falls off the 6X6 tiles which were cleaned and dried before putting the grab bar on. This product is dangerous and gives a false sense of security.
customer_reviews.author: Loves Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Does work and looks quite nice.
customer_reviews.text: This bar had difficulty staying up at least for me and I had attached it to a flat surface. After 8 or 9 hours it would fall off. Finally, I added a bit of liquid to just the center of the suction cups. It has now stayed up for 3 days and remains tight to the wall. It is important to note that the instruction pamphlet that came with the product clearly states that it is to be used only to assist in helping a person and not to be used to fully support a person and their weight.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Did the job and great hold.
customer_reviews.text: It holds great on even our very slightly textured plastic tub liner. Of course just check the hold with a controlled yank or slide before putting all your weight on it. Never budged so far. Not true of a more expensive brand I bought and returned that would not stay on Luke this Vive does!!!!
customer_reviews.author: K Man

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous product
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions exactly. It stuck to the smooth wall of the fiberglass shower in the apartment and showed the correct color to indicate a successful instalation. Half an hour later we heard a crash from the unoccupied bathroom. The grab bar had fallen off the wall! Thankfully no one was trying to use it at the time. Dangerous product!
customer_reviews.author: Lorimar

customer_reviews.title: Clean your tiles!
customer_reviews.text: This product is good and safe when installed properly. The video review from Edward is misleading. YOU MUST CLEAN ALL SURFACES THAT THE SUCTION CUPS COME IN CONTACT. Soap residue, cleaning agents, anything that makes a barrier between the tile and the suction cup will cause the suction to fail. I used a clorox spray - followed by a vigorous wiping with paper towels. I have had superior suction for nearly a month. And on one of the bars ( I bought two), I have moved it three times to get the right position in the shower. NO PROBLEMS if you follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: SNSA

customer_reviews.title: Don't rely on these as safety bars.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a second grab bar after the first one stayed on the shower wall for a couple weeks. The second one fell off in less than a day. Now the first one has fallen off. My wife's hospice nurse said she sees them frequently and never trusts them to hold tight. I have trashed both of mine to avoid someone thinking it could be used as a safety bar.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M

customer_reviews.title: it works fine for balance in the shower
customer_reviews.text: When it doesn't slide, it works fine for balance in the shower. Unfortunately, even though it showed green on both ends, it gave way during the shower itself, scaring the heck out of me. Good potential, but I won't use it again. Guess I'll have to drill holes in the shower surround after all...
customer_reviews.author: Beege

customer_reviews.title: Shower security
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. As a “full figured” adult, needed this for safety in shower stall. Noticed some complaints reguarding units not adhearing in some situations. I did not clean the area where I attached my unit. Have noticed once that the red dot (not attached securely ) was showing. I just resnapped in place. I did test to my satisfaction that in the position of one cup secured and one not fully secured was still strong enough for my needs. Am extremely pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy king

customer_reviews.title: Grab it Carefully!
customer_reviews.text: The idea is wonderful; the reality not so much so. This grab bar is certainly better than nothing, but does NOT work well on some surfaces - glass (as in glass shower stalls), tile (as in a small tile squares shower wall). I mention this because safety is the object, and that is not always the case here. Still, If your bathroom surface is one on which the grab bar works, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would absolutely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Solid product for price. Parents didn't want permanent grab bars yet. These look great compared to other options when installed on white tile. Another brand's "white" for some reason has a lavender hue when compared to actual white tiles. That was important to my mother. They also hold very well, the span is perfect for 4" tiles, and the grip indicators let you know when you've got a good spot and suction achieved. That was important to my father. They like them so much they may just leave these and stop shopping for longer term ones.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Vive Grab Bar - Grab One
customer_reviews.text: Grab bar is attractive yet sturdy looking, and it is sturdy. I attached it to the wall of my fiberglass shower and it held very tightly. I then easily removed it and attached it to ceramic tile wall outside the shower and it again held very tightly. It has been there for over a week and no signs of loosening. It supports putting all of my weight leaning on it when exiting shower. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: The handle does easily attach to the wall and is also easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 3 stars as it works well but for one issue. On each end there is a small metal ball. After about 2 1/2 months of use one of them began to rust. If I had not noticed it I am afraid it would have left a mark on the fiberglass. The handle does easily attach to the wall and is also easy to remove. When it is attached it feels as sturdy as handles that have been attached by screws.
customer_reviews.author: lola

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for a friend that doesn't have a computer. This is her review. It works very well. There is a good tight suction and the red/green indicator is extremely helpful. The ridges on the bar for the hand work very well. She possibly will order another one in the future, but not now. I feel safer in the shower with this bar.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Steventon

customer_reviews.title: Vive Grab Bar Review
customer_reviews.text: We originally ordered two Vive Grab Bars in March, 2018. One of the grab bars had suction failure from time to time and ceased to failed a year later. Purchased two new Vive Grab Bars and both have functioned with issue. Would recommend the Vive Grab Bars, but observe the suction prior to use.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Lad

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how much I could rely on a grab bar attached to our plastic shower insert. However, this bar has color-coded indicators that let you know that it's been installed correctly. The bar feels very secure and I have no hesitation grabbing it and hanging on it with all my weight. I was trying to decide between this longer bar and a shorter one. I'm very glad I chose the longer model.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to have this, and followed the directions. After a few hours I heard it go boom on the floor of the tub. So I washed everything clean, and tried it again. After 3 tries, it just wasn't staying! So sad.
customer_reviews.author: shari amon

customer_reviews.title: It was broken
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this handle so that my husband would have safety in the shower. We have one already, but needed another. One of the suction cups does not work and keeps popping off. So we could not use it. I lost the paperwork, so could not return it. The other one we have is wonderful, sturdy, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful suction.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and remove for any age or power strength. I prefer the suction type compared to the permanent screw in type because you can use them at hotels or wherever when traveling. Great for the elderly, handicap, or injured to use by the bed, toilet and in/out of shower/tub.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Product works fairly well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The only problem I had was that it was just the right length that I was unable to find two tiles the proper width apart without encountering a grout line. It's not the product's fault. If it had only been a half inch longer........... Anyway, I attached it to the shower door to aid my elderly mother when she steps into and out of the shower. Not the optimal location, but much better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Doctordun

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on my shower.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work on my shower with large tiles. Just wouldn't stick at all. I wouldn't trust it to lean on. Disabled people need built-in shower grab bars, not these suction ones. I was hoping I could take it with me when I traveled, but no, this shower grab bar was useless.
customer_reviews.author: ttmadison

customer_reviews.title: Shower handle
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a slight balance issue so I tried this. We do a lot of road trips and I am always concerned for her when she gets in and out of the shower. It was so effective that I bout more for my house to put in all the bathrooms. The product is made very well and is inexpensive. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: murray gruber

customer_reviews.title: Vive Grab Bar
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fact that this has the suction cup feature. This works for what I need, a stability in the shower. You do not need to grab this with all of your body weight, or depend on it to lift you. This is a gently touch, take it slow and a fast solution. This is VERY simple to install. Great for my needs. Thank You!! (Don't be dependent on this bar, it keeps your independence)
customer_reviews.author: ItalianBrian

customer_reviews.title: I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.text: I put it up on a dry clean smooth surface. Two hours later I hear a noise from the bathroom. I go to look and the handle is on the floor. When I put it up it felt very sturdy. The little dots turned from red to green. I put it back up. I'm hoping it holds I'm scared now, if I'm using the shower and holding the handle to steady myself and it fails, I can get seriously hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Mikal

customer_reviews.title: Hard to attach and falls off wall very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for safety while recovering from hip replacement. It is very very hard to push the levers to attach to wall. It is heavy and does not stay attached well at all. I returned this and bought one at the local hardware store. Lightweight, easy to attach, AND stays on the wall for a long long time. Proves that my wall is just fine (12" tiles) and it is this product that's the problem.
customer_reviews.author: N Morris

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy these!
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money and time. They would not stay. We bought three bars, and tried them on two different showers. One bar has stayed in place. The other two bars will not stay, and we have TRIED! They seemed solid when we first installed them, so unfortunately we through the boxes away, so now we are stuck with bars that are completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Quigon73

customer_reviews.title: Rust after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent product overall, just need to remove and re-attach the handle every 2-3 weeks to keep it secure. The big issues that I have are basically the pins/screws get rusty after a few months, it also left some stains on my wall which is really hard to get rid of. Please consider using SST hardware for this type of product especially it's going to be used in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Does not stick for too long
customer_reviews.text: I really loved these when I 1st got them. Was having double hip replaced (6 mos apart) and needed support getting in and out of the shower/tub. Held good for the 1st one but by October, we were used to hearing them fall from the walls. We have tile and I make sure they're centered in the squares and that they're clean. Looking for new ones now...
customer_reviews.author: Debi W.

customer_reviews.title: Great grab bar.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to stabilize me in my shower stall because I have age related balance problems. The Vive Grab Bar helps me feel secure. Easy to attach, attractive, and strong. The first one I ordered works so well I have ordered a second one. A good thing to have. I now have installed the second bar. I feel much safer knowing that these grab bars are there. I may get a third bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay
customer_reviews.text: Cleaned wall where I put it up. Green mark showing on both ends. A few hours later I found it in bathtub floor I am disappointed in this product . I am surprised that Amazon sells this product . I depend on everything I buy with Amazon. this product is a NO NO
customer_reviews.author: luckymary

customer_reviews.title: Update: Grab bars worked great for about 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Update: The grab bars worked great for about 9 months, but then started falling off the wall daily. Being in the bath/shower area the metal pieces by the suction rusted and the suction cups no longer hold the bar on the tile. Previous review: Product works as described. My 91 yr old mother feels more secure getting in and out of the shower with the grab bars to hold on to. These fit perfectly on 4" tiles and the green indicators are very noticeable, even for her. I would recommend these grab bars.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Make sure that the surface will hold the suction cup.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to mount the grab bar on the tile in the shower and it kept falling off. I requested a replacement and it arrived before I even sent off the defective one! Now that one fell off, too, so I decided that perhaps the tile was too porous and mounted it on the glass . It now holds perfectly. I assume it would hold well on glazed tile.
customer_reviews.author: Arthurdog

customer_reviews.title: Apply to Wet Surface Seems Best Grip
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I’ve purchased. The first has been in our vacation rental and no one has complained and it seems to be securely in place each time we clean. I recently purchased another for our own shower. I followed directions and it said to attach to a clean and DRY surface. That sounded counterintuitive to me, but I followed the directions and it kept releasing the suction within a day. Do finally, I followed my instinct and wet the surface and it’s been secured tightly for weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: debra c.

customer_reviews.title: Great size but dont trust stability
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and that the suction bar is easy to install and remove. However I don't trust the stability and suction power. Sometimes it would fall within minutes of installing. You have to keep testing where it will have a better suction and checking prior to each use. I finally found a place that it will stick to more than 1 day to a couple of days. I wouldn't trust my 80 year old mother to use by herself without prior testing. We have a stand up shower. Due to bathroom size and material we were not able to install permanent grab bars. This is a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous to use because it come off easy
customer_reviews.text: Suction power is not enough to be used. It gives away after couple of weeks. Installed it for my mom after her release from hospital. It worked briefly and my mom got injured while grabbing it and it came off and she slipped. Not recommend it and should not be sold
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for trips where the bathroom has no handholds. It's bigger than I thought, seems very solid. Tried it on vintage bathroom tiles, it adhered. I noticed some negative reviews where people had left it on for extended periods. It's designed to be portable. If you need a permanent grab bar, you should have one professionally installed. Every bathroom should have them.
customer_reviews.author: allmac

customer_reviews.title: Good product if it would stay attached
customer_reviews.text: Well made, perfect size, will not adhere to the tile. Did everything they instructed, clean tile, clean suction cups made sure everything was dry. It was attached about 20 minutes and fell off. Went through the process again, same thing. Like I said it is just what I needed have now decided attach right before I get out of the shower and take it off when done. Good product if would stay attached.
customer_reviews.author: SMZ

customer_reviews.title: Having a grip bar for my health if not then a refund.
customer_reviews.text: Did not stick in none of my showers. My walls are not smooth so I bought a smooth circular adhesive grip so I can place grab bar on it for smooth surface. Still did not work. Sending back time has expired so I lost money. Bought 2 large and one small. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Davila

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: Yes, when I attached the product it was a very strong attachment and stable BUT, the key to using any suction cup bar is to only attach when you are going to use and detach when you're done. The suction won't hold for hours and will drop off the wall. Be careful and test often when someone is using it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Uhl

customer_reviews.title: Seems Great, but won't work on most showers
customer_reviews.text: Because of the suction cups this won't work on any shower that isn't built into home. My parents home is 30 years old - has shower and tin insets glued to the wall. While this will attach it would never hold if they were using it in a fall or slip situation. Having to return and get s professional.
customer_reviews.author: K. Conduff

product_meta.title: Vive Grab Bar - Suction Shower Handle - Bathroom Balance Bar - Safety Hand Rail Support for Tub, Handicap, Elderly, Injury, Kid, Senior Assist Bath Handle, Non Skid
feature_bullets: PLEASE NOTE: This is a suction cup device and this device will not work on a porous surface such as fiberglass. The device must be applied to smooth, flat, non-porous surfaces. It CANNOT be applied over grout lines and will not work on textured surfaces. We also recommend reapplying the grab bar once a week. Cannot support full body weight.

STURDY AND SECURE: Strong suction cup design only works on any non-porous, flat surface, including tile, glass, acrylic and metal. Provides additional stability for up to 300 lbs when entering and exiting the tub or shower for a safe and comfortable experience

SIMPLE TOOL-FREE INSTALLATION: Grab bar is easy to install or remove from the tub or shower walls with locking latches to secure bar in place. For additional convenience, each latch has a color indicator for ensuring a safe and secure installation. A green display means the grab bar is secure and ready for use. Red will be displayed if the seal is not airtight. User must also be able to apply 10lbs of pressure to ensure they can use device clamps.

COMFORTABLE, NON SLIP GRIP: Textured, contoured rubber provides a comfortable non slip grip, perfect for the injured, elderly and toddlers. The underside of the handle features molded finger grips for additional safety and security. Space created by gently curving from the wall or tub is a generous 3.25” leaving ample room for fingers to grasp the handle securely.

EASY TO ADJUST POSITION ON TUB OR SHOWER: Lift tabs allow the grab bar to be repositioned easily. Adjust the height on the shower wall, change to the side of the tub and even take it with you when traveling for a safe bath or shower anywhere. The grab bar will not harm surfaces when installed and used properly.
